title: The OSCARS
body_text:
Their time had come.
Ryan Letsche vs. Grant Cornero
- arguably the past year's most prominent warriors collided on the superbowl stage, DODGEBALL CXX!
The newly-crowned
ROOKIE of the Year
seeked that first win of his storied career. One could just sense his physical and mental readiness for the challenge that faced him. The innovative catching phenom Letsche stood in his way, and there wasn't any doubt his preparation and will to win would be at an all-time high.
In the early stages of the fierce, and yes, wet onslaught, the athletically-blessed Cornero mounted a successful offense against his never-say-die counterpart. "Cockroach" Juan Londono and Season 1 icon Kevin Adams each proved to be two of Cornero's most formidible assets.
PLAYER of the Year
nominee Letsche wasn't out though, and made every attempt to take the lead, coming extremely close on mutliple occasions. The self-proclaimed "Creation" John Tronolone and hot hands catcher Mike "Sputz" Krott would arduously fight to the bitter end.
But by the eighth contest, nothing or no one could stop the fueled locamotive Cornero, stomping the competition into oblivian for the remainder of this 120th spectacular.
Flash Results by Game
:
Cornero defeated Letsche, 8 - 3.
Cornero: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11
Letsche: 3, 5, 7
Pitiless pain, cruel punishment, the very medicine Cornero prescribed to his CXX rival general! Plus, Team Letsche's inability to smack the brand-spankin'-new neon star rims ultimately lead to their demise.
Grant Cornero
defeated
Ryan Letsche
, 8 to 3, at Season 12 Finale, DODGEBALL CXX.
EastCoastDodgeball
would like to congratulate all of the nominees and winners for a fantastic 2007.
RIVALRY of the Year
:
C. Adams vs. Fitzpatrick - Londono vs. T. Adams - Megill vs. Edwards - Basista vs. Marzarella -
WALL vs. ALL
WALL vs. ALL took the top prize with about 50% of the vote. The trophy was presented to the creator of this classic feud, Ryan Letsche. The year-long struggle between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick placed in a close second.
New CONCEPT of the Year
:
PickYourPoison Rules - BoxBall Dodgeball -
CREAMation Rules
- The Dodgeball Draft
The dreaded
CREAMation Rules
narrowly captured the gold in this one. A mere two votes seperated it from
BoxBall Dodgeball
. The brains behind the
CREAMation
, John Tronolone, received the trophy.
PLAYER of the Year
:
Mike Edwards - Lauren Stopa -
Kevin Adams
- Ryan Letsche
The presitgious
PLAYER of the Year
medal was awarded to the legendary Kevin Adams. Interesingly, all of the other condidates shared the same number of votes.
ROOKIE of the Year
:
Sascha Basista - Michael Butler -
Grant Cornero
- Juan Londono - Rob Pellecchia - Justin Wolf
In the tightest race, DODGEBALL CXX headliner Grant Cornero squeeked by runner-up Michael "M Bizzle" Butler by a single vote. Rob Pellecchia scored an impressive third, only trailing Cornero by two votes.
Season 12
~ Wall's third triumph over All, the colossal "War to Settle the Scores" at CXV,
John vs. Tom
at the Second Annual Christmas Special, and the returning "Double Header" were just some of the highlights over the last ten weeks.
~ Season 12's average attendance was 26.3. The sport witnessed the introduction of 14 new stars.
~ DODGEBALL 116, DODGEBALL 118, DODGEBALL CXX were all
Wet Wars
.
~ Diana DiBuccio, Kevin Adams, Ryan Letsche, and John Tronolone participated in all Season 12 events.
DODGEBALL CXX
~ One would have thought it was flag day. Four huge yellow and blue flags, six smaller flags attached to the tennis poles and table, white and blue streamers draped along the fence - don't forget about the Christmas lights either!
~ First pick for Cornero:
Kevin Adams
~ First pick for Letsche:
John Tronolone
~ The 50/50 Raffle earned $35, split equally between the winners Rob Pellecchia and Kevin Megill.
~ The celebratory afterpaty was held at Pete and Elda's in Neptune! Nearly 20 superstars gathered for the occasion!
~ The red hot CXX Soundtrack produced such hits from the popular Top Gun movie, various Spanish anthems including "La Bamba", and the comedic "Barbie Girl". Disturbed, Amber, Finger Eleven, and so many more could also be heard live and loud.
DODGEBALL 121 Match
The sport's headed to Philadelphia! Okay, not really. Brothers battle it out when
Michael Butler
takes on
Jim Butler
at the Season 13 opening!
DODGEBALL CXX - the grandest way to kick-off the new year! Here are few moments!
~ Bobby Vetrano over-inflating many of the bulletballs.
~ The neon pink and orange Star Rims.
~ Diana DiBuccio blowing her trumpet to begin the show.
~ Chris Adams and Melissa Kerr the only combatants to earn a team regeneration.
~ "Last Man Standing" performances from both Kevin Fitzpatrick and Rob Pellecchia.
~ Justin Wolf's night-long catches.
~ Sascha Basista successful dodges while parading around with an American flag.
~ Chris Adams destroying one of the colorful flags with a powerful bulletball throw.
Attendance of DODGEBALL CXX was
28
.
For the first time in ten event history, there were no new players.
Notable returns include Jim Martin (last competed at DB 100), Michelle Mullins (last competed at DB 114), Valerie Winston (last competed at DB 114), Lauren Winston (last competed at DB 114), and Steve Pham (last competed at DB CXV).
DODGEBALL CXX was the sixth season finale held on the back courts of Wall High School. The newly-created orange and pink
Letsche Rims 2008
were used for the first time.
DODGEBALL CXX was the first ten event held in the month of January.
The official theme song was "Ready to Go" by Republica.
In one of the more rare occurrences, CXX was
Wet War XXIV
. This was the third ten event
Wet War
(along with DODGEBALL 30 and DODGEBALL 80) and the third
Wet War
in the last five events.
This was the second event to feature a 50/50 Raffle (the first being DODGEBALL 100). By the end of the night, Rob Pellecchia and Kevin Megill were $17.50 richer.
In the first main event of 2008, Grant Cornero defeated Ryan Letsche 8 to 3.
--
Letsche
participated in his second ten event, the other being DODGEBALL 100. His record unfortunately slides to 2-5-0.
--
Cornero
made his ten event captains debut, capturing the first win of his career. He is now 1-2-0.
Bobby Vetrano and Steve Pham made their season finale debut.
Kevin Adams and John Tronolone are the only combatants to have participated in all 12 Season Finale extravaganzas.
Adding a Little Flare!
Special
Thanks!
to John Tronolone, Lauren Winston, Valerie Winston, and Kathryn Nogueira for setting up the many decorations around the court. The colorful lights were beautifully put up by the one and only Mike "Sputz" Krott. His efforts are very much appreciated as well.
CXX Soundtrack!
Special
Thanks!
to the legendary Ryan Letsche who put together one hell of a soundtrack for this 120th spectacle.
You Peeps Rock!
2005, 2006, 2007, and now 2008; just how much longer will the incredible  journey last?! In regards to DODGEBALL CXX, Season 12 went out with a bang! A phenomenal main event, the distribution of the
Gold Awards
, and so much more created yet another lifelong memory for all involved.
Thanks!
to everyone!
......................................
SEASON 13 Schedule
DODGEBALL 121: January 12, 2008 (Michael Butler vs. Jim Butler)
DODGEBALL 122: January 19, 2008
DODGEBALL 123: January 26, 2008 (Kevin Fitzpatrick vs. Lenny Herrera)
DODGEBALL 124: February 2, 2008 ("Secret Selection")
DODGEBALL 125: February 9, 2008
DODGEBALL 126: February 16, 2008
DODGEBALL 127: February 23, 2008 (WALL vs. ALL 5)
DODGEBALL 128: March 1, 2008
DODGEBALL 129: March 8, 2008
DODGEBALL 130: March 15, 2008
body_html:
Their time had come. Ryan Letsche vs. Grant Cornero - arguably the past year's most prominent warriors collided on the superbowl stage, DODGEBALL CXX!

The newly-crowned ROOKIE of the Year seeked that first win of his storied career. One could just sense his physical and mental readiness for the challenge that faced him. The innovative catching phenom Letsche stood in his way, and there wasn't any doubt his preparation and will to win would be at an all-time high.

In the early stages of the fierce, and yes, wet onslaught, the athletically-blessed Cornero mounted a successful offense against his never-say-die counterpart. "Cockroach" Juan Londono and Season 1 icon Kevin Adams each proved to be two of Cornero's most formidible assets.

PLAYER of the Year nominee Letsche wasn't out though, and made every attempt to take the lead, coming extremely close on mutliple occasions. The self-proclaimed "Creation" John Tronolone and hot hands catcher Mike "Sputz" Krott would arduously fight to the bitter end.

But by the eighth contest, nothing or no one could stop the fueled locamotive Cornero, stomping the competition into oblivian for the remainder of this 120th spectacular.

Flash Results by Game: Cornero defeated Letsche, 8 - 3.
Cornero: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11
Letsche: 3, 5, 7

Pitiless pain, cruel punishment, the very medicine Cornero prescribed to his CXX rival general! Plus, Team Letsche's inability to smack the brand-spankin'-new neon star rims ultimately lead to their demise.

Grant Cornero defeated Ryan Letsche, 8 to 3, at Season 12 Finale, DODGEBALL CXX.


EastCoastDodgeball would like to congratulate all of the nominees and winners for a fantastic 2007.

RIVALRY of the Year: C. Adams vs. Fitzpatrick - Londono vs. T. Adams - Megill vs. Edwards - Basista vs. Marzarella - WALL vs. ALL
WALL vs. ALL took the top prize with about 50% of the vote. The trophy was presented to the creator of this classic feud, Ryan Letsche. The year-long struggle between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick placed in a close second.

New CONCEPT of the Year: PickYourPoison Rules - BoxBall Dodgeball - CREAMation Rules - The Dodgeball Draft
The dreaded CREAMation Rules narrowly captured the gold in this one. A mere two votes seperated it from BoxBall Dodgeball. The brains behind the CREAMation, John Tronolone, received the trophy.

PLAYER of the Year: Mike Edwards - Lauren Stopa - Kevin Adams - Ryan Letsche
The presitgious PLAYER of the Year medal was awarded to the legendary Kevin Adams. Interesingly, all of the other condidates shared the same number of votes.

ROOKIE of the Year: Sascha Basista - Michael Butler - Grant Cornero - Juan Londono - Rob Pellecchia - Justin Wolf
In the tightest race, DODGEBALL CXX headliner Grant Cornero squeeked by runner-up Michael "M Bizzle" Butler by a single vote. Rob Pellecchia scored an impressive third, only trailing Cornero by two votes.



Season 12
~ Wall's third triumph over All, the colossal "War to Settle the Scores" at CXV, John vs. Tom at the Second Annual Christmas Special, and the returning "Double Header" were just some of the highlights over the last ten weeks.
~ Season 12's average attendance was 26.3. The sport witnessed the introduction of 14 new stars.
~ DODGEBALL 116, DODGEBALL 118, DODGEBALL CXX were all Wet Wars.
~ Diana DiBuccio, Kevin Adams, Ryan Letsche, and John Tronolone participated in all Season 12 events.

DODGEBALL CXX
~ One would have thought it was flag day. Four huge yellow and blue flags, six smaller flags attached to the tennis poles and table, white and blue streamers draped along the fence - don't forget about the Christmas lights either!
~ First pick for Cornero: Kevin Adams
~ First pick for Letsche: John Tronolone
~ The 50/50 Raffle earned $35, split equally between the winners Rob Pellecchia and Kevin Megill.
~ The celebratory afterpaty was held at Pete and Elda's in Neptune! Nearly 20 superstars gathered for the occasion!
~ The red hot CXX Soundtrack produced such hits from the popular Top Gun movie, various Spanish anthems including "La Bamba", and the comedic "Barbie Girl". Disturbed, Amber, Finger Eleven, and so many more could also be heard live and loud.
DODGEBALL 121 Match
The sport's headed to Philadelphia! Okay, not really. Brothers battle it out when Michael Butler takes on Jim Butler at the Season 13 opening!



DODGEBALL CXX - the grandest way to kick-off the new year! Here are few moments!
~ Bobby Vetrano over-inflating many of the bulletballs.
~ The neon pink and orange Star Rims.
~ Diana DiBuccio blowing her trumpet to begin the show.
~ Chris Adams and Melissa Kerr the only combatants to earn a team regeneration.
~ "Last Man Standing" performances from both Kevin Fitzpatrick and Rob Pellecchia.
~ Justin Wolf's night-long catches.
~ Sascha Basista successful dodges while parading around with an American flag.
~ Chris Adams destroying one of the colorful flags with a powerful bulletball throw.


Attendance of DODGEBALL CXX was 28.

For the first time in ten event history, there were no new players.

Notable returns include Jim Martin (last competed at DB 100), Michelle Mullins (last competed at DB 114), Valerie Winston (last competed at DB 114), Lauren Winston (last competed at DB 114), and Steve Pham (last competed at DB CXV).

DODGEBALL CXX was the sixth season finale held on the back courts of Wall High School. The newly-created orange and pink Letsche Rims 2008 were used for the first time.

DODGEBALL CXX was the first ten event held in the month of January.

The official theme song was "Ready to Go" by Republica.

In one of the more rare occurrences, CXX was Wet War XXIV. This was the third ten event Wet War (along with DODGEBALL 30 and DODGEBALL 80) and the third Wet War in the last five events.

This was the second event to feature a 50/50 Raffle (the first being DODGEBALL 100). By the end of the night, Rob Pellecchia and Kevin Megill were $17.50 richer.

In the first main event of 2008, Grant Cornero defeated Ryan Letsche 8 to 3.
-- Letsche participated in his second ten event, the other being DODGEBALL 100. His record unfortunately slides to 2-5-0.
-- Cornero made his ten event captains debut, capturing the first win of his career. He is now 1-2-0.

Bobby Vetrano and Steve Pham made their season finale debut.

Kevin Adams and John Tronolone are the only combatants to have participated in all 12 Season Finale extravaganzas.



Adding a Little Flare!
Special Thanks! to John Tronolone, Lauren Winston, Valerie Winston, and Kathryn Nogueira for setting up the many decorations around the court. The colorful lights were beautifully put up by the one and only Mike "Sputz" Krott. His efforts are very much appreciated as well.

CXX Soundtrack!
Special Thanks! to the legendary Ryan Letsche who put together one hell of a soundtrack for this 120th spectacle.

You Peeps Rock!
2005, 2006, 2007, and now 2008; just how much longer will the incredible journey last?! In regards to DODGEBALL CXX, Season 12 went out with a bang! A phenomenal main event, the distribution of the Gold Awards, and so much more created yet another lifelong memory for all involved. Thanks! to everyone!


......................................


SEASON 13 Schedule
DODGEBALL 121: January 12, 2008 (Michael Butler vs. Jim Butler)
DODGEBALL 122: January 19, 2008
DODGEBALL 123: January 26, 2008 (Kevin Fitzpatrick vs. Lenny Herrera)
DODGEBALL 124: February 2, 2008 ("Secret Selection")
DODGEBALL 125: February 9, 2008
DODGEBALL 126: February 16, 2008
DODGEBALL 127: February 23, 2008 (WALL vs. ALL 5)
DODGEBALL 128: March 1, 2008
DODGEBALL 129: March 8, 2008
DODGEBALL 130: March 15, 2008
